title: If You’re Bulding Your Closet From Scratch, These Summer Basics From H&M, Zara, & Mango Will Help
description: Your in-depth shopping guide to a basics refresh.
excerpt: Shop the best warm-weather basics at H&M, Zara & Mango.
text: I don’t know about you, but I can’t wait to embrace summer and soak in the sun. Lounging beachside, outdoor dinners, and movies on a lush grassy field are just a few of the activities that make me wish summer were here even sooner. While I’ve been prepping for the season ahead by auditing my wardrobe, it’s become very clear that I have some major wardrobe gaps. These missing pieces can easily be filled by adding a handful of essentials, so I’m officially on the hunt for some new summer basics to round out my closet. I’ve decided to take you all along for the journey in case you share similar sartorial problems. I’m digging through H&M, Zara, and Mango to find the perfect set of pieces to make my summer fashion favorites shine.If you’re like me, finding elevated basic staples that you can wear repeatedly is of the utmost importance. Luckily, I’ve found some seriously good summer clothing contenders during my H&M, Zara, and Mango deep dive. Keep scrolling to shop my favorite pieces from my hunt. From light and airy blouses, dresses, and pants to the most beautiful everyday shoes, there’s truly such a great mix containing the best summer basics from these top retailers. Get ready to complete your fun summer outfit combinations with a few key buys ahead.H&M This black strapless number will be great for a summer LBD pick. It' s officially linen season. H&M Scalloped-Edge Fine-Knit Tank Top H&M Oversized Linen Shirt There's no such thing as having too many button-downs. H&M Ring-Detail Flip-Flops The perfect little bit of hardware. These tiny shorts will go with so much in the coming months. I'm loving these versatile dress shorts. H&M Defined-Waist T-Shirt Dress We love a defined waist detail. Pair with your favorite skirts and pants. I have a feeling these will sell out first. H&M Denim Drawstring Pants Light weight denim that's made for hot temperatures. Zara ZARA Satin Midi Dress 50th Anniversary Mix and match with your favorite button-downs, jackets, sandals, and sneakers. ZARA Leather Kitten Heeled Sandals 50th Anniversary T-strap heels have been on the rise as of late. ZARA Satin Effect Ballet Flats 50th Anniversary The satin laces Make these beauties look so delicate. ZARA Elastic Waist Wide Leg Pants We love an easy breezy pant. ZARA Braided Belted Chino Pants White pants look *chef's kiss* with all the white tops and shoes. ZARA Zw Collection Midi Button Dress A great everyday LWD option. ZARA 100% Linen Fitted Blazer Zw Collection Fitted blazers are on the rise. This cinched style in linen is calling to me. ZARA Zw Collection Linen Blend Pants Add in matching pants for the cutest lightweight sumemr suit moment. ZARA Zw Collection High-Waisted Palazzo Jeans There's something so elevated about wider-leg pants. ZARA Ruched Leather Loafers Add some white loafers to your summer flat shoe rotation. Mango MANGO Strapless Knitted Top - Women | Mango Usa This will get worn over and over. MANGO Squared Frame Sunglasses - Women | Mango Usa These statement sunnies will take all your looks to the next level. MANGO Kitten-Heel Sandals With Strap - Women | Mango Usa I can't believe these are so inexpensive. MANGO Linen Skirt With Pleat Detail - Women | Mango Usa More linen skirts all of 2025. MANGO Linen Pants With Draped Waist - Women | Mango Usa MANGO Flared Midi Skirt - Women | Mango Usa These flared skirts are such a vibe. MANGO Danila Wideleg High-Rise Jeans - Women | Mango Usa White jeans are such a summer staple. MANGO Halter Neck Cotton Midi-Dress - Women | Mango Usa Perfect for a picnic date night. MANGO Gathered Cotton T-Shirt - Women | Mango Usa MANGO Braided Leather Shoulder Bag - Women | Mango Usa This braided leather bag is such a great carryall for all your favorite handbag items. Explore More: H&M Zara Mango Chinazor "Chichi" Offor is a Georgia-born, Los Angeles–based associate editor who relocated from Brooklyn, New York, and joined Who What Wear's West Coast office in 2022. At WWW, she utilizes over 10 years of editorial experience to dish out shopping advice to the masses and analyze key pop-cultural moments. Chichi previously worked at Refinery29, where she helped revolutionize the brand’s plus-size and inclusive fashion coverage. In her spare time, she’s keeping up with the latest movie releases, enjoying a relaxing day at the spa, or obsessing over her latest ADHD-fueled hyperfixation (e.g., Jesse McCartney's underrated career, the negative effects of bicoastal intellectual elitism, and Gen Z’s loneliness epidemic). You can find her online @thechichio on Instagram.
html:
I don’t know about you, but I can’t wait to embrace summer and soak in the sun. Lounging beachside, outdoor dinners, and movies on a lush grassy field are just a few of the activities that make me wish summer were here even sooner. While I’ve been prepping for the season ahead by auditing my wardrobe, it’s become very clear that I have some major wardrobe gaps. These missing pieces can easily be filled by adding a handful of essentials, so I’m officially on the hunt for some new summer basics to round out my closet. I’ve decided to take you all along for the journey in case you share similar sartorial problems. I’m digging through H&M, Zara, and Mango to find the perfect set of pieces to make my summer fashion favorites shine.

If you’re like me, finding elevated basic staples that you can wear repeatedly is of the utmost importance. Luckily, I’ve found some seriously good summer clothing contenders during my H&M, Zara, and Mango deep dive. Keep scrolling to shop my favorite pieces from my hunt. From light and airy blouses, dresses, and pants to the most beautiful everyday shoes, there’s truly such a great mix containing the best summer basics from these top retailers. Get ready to complete your fun summer outfit combinations with a few key buys ahead.

This black strapless number will be great for a summer LBD pick.

It' s officially linen season.

Chinazor "Chichi" Offor is a Georgia-born, Los Angeles–based associate editor who relocated from Brooklyn, New York, and joined Who What Wear's West Coast office in 2022. At WWW, she utilizes over 10 years of editorial experience to dish out shopping advice to the masses and analyze key pop-cultural moments. Chichi previously worked at Refinery29, where she helped revolutionize the brand’s plus-size and inclusive fashion coverage. In her spare time, she’s keeping up with the latest movie releases, enjoying a relaxing day at the spa, or obsessing over her latest ADHD-fueled hyperfixation (e.g., Jesse McCartney's underrated career, the negative effects of bicoastal intellectual elitism, and Gen Z’s loneliness epidemic). You can find her online @thechichio on Instagram.
